alert.note: Alert for Butler; Elk; Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 10:06PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Elk, northern Cowley, southern Butler, northeastern Sumner and Greenwood Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 1004 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms along a line from Douglass to Eureka, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Augusta, Mulvane, Rose Hill, Eureka, Douglass, Belle Plaine, Oxford, Udall, Leon, Madison, Hamilton, Severy, Atlanta, Latham, Rosalia, Rock, Climax, Virgil, Eureka City Lake and Thrall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for south central, southeastern and east central Kansas.
